    • Method Detail

      • getMaxDepth

        public int getMaxDepth()
        Returns the maximum depth to be used for search. This value indicates how many game moves in the future are going to be explored in order to compute the value for a state.
        Returns:
        the maximum depth to be used for search.

      • setMaxDepth

        public void setMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        Sets the maximum depth to be used for search. This value indicates how many game moves in the future are going to be explored in order to compute the value for a state.
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - is the value used to set this.maxDepth.

      • getProblem

        public P getProblem()
        Returns the problem associated with this search engine.
        Returns:
        a reference to the problem associated with this search engine.

      • setProblem

        public void setProblem(P p)
        Sets the problem associated with the search engine.
        Parameters:
        p - is the search problem to be used for search (to set 'problem' to).

      • computeValue

        public abstract int computeValue(State state)
        Starts the search in order to compute a value for a state. The computation is performed by exploring the game tree corresponding to the problem being analysed, considering state as the root, and with maximum depth maxDepth.
        Parameters:
        state - is the state for which its value is being computed.
        Returns:
        the value computed for the state.

      • computeSuccessor

        public abstract State computeSuccessor(State state)
        Starts the search in order to compute a most promising successor for a state. The computation is performed by exploring the game tree corresponding to the problem being analysed, considering state as the root, and with maximum depth maxDepth.
        Parameters:
        state - is the state for which its most promising successor is being computed.
        Returns:
        the most promising successor for state. The method ruleApplied() in the result indicates which rule led to the state.

      • report

        public abstract void report()
        Reports information regarding a previously executed search.
